aegis.acteval.samplers module¶

class aegis.acteval.samplers.AdaptiveFixedTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples from the strata, corresponding to the opt sampler that samples proportionally according to the variance of each stratum. Draws proportional exactly instead of using a multinomial.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Sample adaptively according to an “optimal” sampling scheme, which is sampling proportional to the score_variances of each stratum. This enables taking more samples for a stratum with a higher variance.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'AdaptiveFixedTrialSampler'¶

name = 'AdaptiveTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.ProportionalFixedTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples from the strata, sampling proportionally to the population size of each stratum. This uses the population estimates or the populations according to the metrics, which for some metrics may not be the number of trials. This proportional sampler draws a deterministic number of samples rather than using a multinomial distribution with the proportional probabilities.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Sample proportional to the stratum population size. Population will be estimated for metrics like precision where the population is not merely the number of trials in the stratum.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'ProportionalFixedTrialSampler'¶

class aegis.acteval.samplers.RandomFixedTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples randomly regardless of stratification. Calls the metric get_trials_to_sample_from() in order to only sample relevant trials.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples randomly regardless of stratification. However, it does call the metric get_trials_to_sample_from for each stratum so that all sampled trials are relevant.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'RandomFixedTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.RandomTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples randomly regardless of stratification. RandomTrialSampler calls the metric get_trials_to_sample_from() in order to only sample relevant trials.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples randomly regardless of stratification. However, it does call the metric get_trials_to_sample_from for each stratum so that all sampled trials are relevant.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'RandomTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class to support different sampling methods.

abstract draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Method that provides the strategy of drawing samples. Will vary when needed for comparative experiments.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

meets_confidence_criteria(strata, delta, alpha, metric)[source]¶

Takes a strata, with its strategy to aggregate the confidence intervals of the different systems in the strata, and a metric to compute confidence intervals, and returns if with probability >= 1-alpha the confidence interval width is bounded by delta.

Parameters

  • strata (aegis.acteval.strata.Strata) – The strata object

  • delta (float) – The delta to be within

  • alpha (float) – The alpha parameter of the confidence interval (or the probability level of the confidence interval)

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric according to which to compute the confidence criteria

Returns

meets_criteria a boolean that determines if the sample meets the confidence criteria within the specified parameters.

Return type

bool

meets_confidence_delta(conf_value, delta)[source]¶

Submethod useful for testing if we meet the confidence criteria from the Sampler object rather than the Strata object.

Parameters

  • conf_value (float) – The previously computed confidence value

  • delta (float) – The delta of uncertainty to be within.

Returns

True if the confidence range is within the specified delta False, otherwise

Return type

bool

name = ''¶
sample_next_round(num_previous_successes)[source]¶

Method to determine if we should sample another round.

Parameters

num_previous_successes (int) – The number of previous consecutive successful rounds

Returns

True if another round should be sampled, and False otherwise.

Return type

bool

class aegis.acteval.samplers.TrueRandomFixedTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples randomly regardless of stratification. Samples from all trials without consulting the metric. This means that in many iterations non-relevant trials may be sampled for metrics such as precision where not all trials are relevant.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples from all stratum from all possible unsampled trials. This includes trials that the metric may deem as not relevant.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'TrueRandomFixedTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.TrueRandomTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples randomly regardless of stratification. Samples from all trials, regardless of whether they are relevant or not.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples randomly regardless of stratification. Draws from all samples, including some that may not be relevant.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'TrueRandomTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.UniformFixedTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples from the strata uniformly, drawing the same number of samples from each stratum. This does not use a multinomial distribution but a deterministic

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples uniformly from each strata, meaning that each strata will get num_samples/self.strata.num_strata samples.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object

name = 'UniformFixedTrialSampler'¶
class aegis.acteval.samplers.UniformTrialSampler(strata, num_success_rounds_required)[source]¶

Bases: aegis.acteval.samplers.TrialSampler

Draws samples from the strata uniformly, drawing from a uniform multinomial. This uniform sampler draws a deterministic number of samples rather than using a multinomial distribution with the uniform probabilities.

draw_samples(num_samples, metric, rng=None, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

Samples uniformly from each strata, meaning that each strata will get num_samples/self.strata.num_strata samples.

Parameters

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to draw at each step

  • metric (aegis.acteval.metrics.Metric) – The metric object used for scoring

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState, optional) – The Random_number generator provided from the controller. If set to None, it is not provided and will be unique to this sampler. None is provided by default

  • alpha (float, optional) – The desired confidence level. Used for sampling when population estimates have variances

Returns

A list of trial_id values to sample.

Return type

list of object
